intro: Senecio letouzeyanus, commonly known as the KwaZulu-Natal senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
